metadata.Title: CVE-2018-20021 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
LibVNC before commit c3115350eb8bb635d0fdb4dbbb0d0541f38ed19c contains a CWE-835: Infinite loop vulnerability in VNC client code. Vulnerability allows attacker to consume excessive amount of resources like CPU and RAM

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2018-20021` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvncclient1 - 0.9.11+dfsg-1.2
libvncserver1 - 0.9.11+dfsg-1.2
No subscription required

ssvnc - 1.0.29-5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvncserver package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.9.11+dfsg-1.2').
ssvnc package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.29-5').
tightvnc package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
